title: Thunderbird crashes with a single keystroke
content:
I am a huge Tbird fan, using it forever, donating to it, recommending it to others BUT... GEEZ, ever since this new total rebuild, it's become so inconsistent and unstable as to be almost unusable.

In fact, now I can't use it at all because a single keystroke causes it to crash. Even the crash reporter crashes! I am on the latest version 115.7.0 I have gone into troubleshooting mode, disabling all add-ons

Nothing helps. The problems began with the mouse double-clicking with a single click. Fixed that with removing and reinstalling mouse device driver.

Now, as mentioned, when I reply, place a cursor and type a single keystroke, Tbird crashes. As mentioned it pops up a crash reporter. I can't type in that...as soon as I try, it crashes! (Yes, the crash reporter crashes!)

Sadly, I am really dependent on Thunderbird. Is there anyway I can go back to a stable version before this giant rebuild was created. Seems the problems all began then.

thanks for any help, advice, Pradhan
creator: pradhanbalter

title: Very slow downloading of new emails
content:
Each time I start my PC, and Thunderbird starts downloading emails, this takes around 5 minutes for 10-20 emails, and Thunderbird regularly becomes unresponsive for a few seconds while doing it.

I'm using Windows 11 and latest TB version (115.7.0 (32-bit)).

My INBOX folder has 72,000 emails in it and 6.9 GM. Can it be because of this size? I already compacted it, so that size is already compacted.

I wanna keep all my emails for reference and archive, and on the server side this is no issue, I pay for a provider. Now I also wanna keep ALL my mails locally on my PC in a mail client, in Thunderbird. So ideally I don't wanna delete emails, delete large attachments, or split them into sub-folders by year etc.

Does anyone have an idea what the best solution could be?

Thanks
creator: r_matz

title: Thunderbird 115.6.0 64bit  - Changing background colours in Message/Folders Pane on Linux Mint 21.3
content:
Intro : I find the glaring background is hard on my eyes and the black/dark background seems not right. Trying to soften background with a lighter shades rather than glaring white. I am no IT person but like to dabble on a spare PC to try and get it right.

I have tried applying this method https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1418832 with no change or noticeable damage. Feel as so though its close I have mixed it up a bit with the 2 examples given with half a dozen of my thoughts to no avail. Here is my last .CSS file attempt . See below

I realise I don’t understand all of this and I could go learn all about .CSS Files. I also realise I could spend any amount of time learning it. To not use in the next couple of years and I have forgotten or it has changed again. So please if someone could help me out here. I thank you in advance and appreciate the contributors here for their post that I have used in the past.

Regards George

title: Moved folder from POP account to local folder lost all content
content:
Howdy, I have a number of folders under my POP email account folder. I moved a couple of them to the local folder using drag and drop. It seemed to be going OK but when I went to double check the content, all the messages where gone. I could not find them in trash nor were they in the "from" or "destination" folder. The only things that were saved were the folders and subfolders.

This seemed like a simple move operation but it has gone very wrong. Any ideas why?

I have backups. Can someone point me to the procedure to recover specific folders in email?

I have been trying to search for a solution but have not been successful in even finding this issue.

This is on a Win10 PC running 115.7.0 (64-bit) version of Tbird.

Thanks!

title: Lightning event details popup opens up too small - need to resize it every time I view an event
content:
When I double-click on an event in my TB Lightning calendar, the event details window/popup/whatever-you-call-it opens up at a fixed size which 90% of the time is too short vertically to see the Edit button. This forces me to have to resize it manually just to be able to click on Edit. This is making the calendar very annoying to do. Any of the following might help:

  1. How can I change the default popup window size?
  2. How can I make the manually selected size sticky?
  3. Can you change the default size to automatically be tall enough for the Edit button to be visible?

Thanks for your help

Gerard

title: Svuotamento cestino cartelle locali
content:
Buongiorno, da quando ho installato Thunderbird supernova 115.7.0 (uso thunderbird da anni e mi sono sempre trovato molto bene), ho dei problemi a svuotare il cestino locale.

Mi spiego meglio, ho un account aruba in POP3, quando scarico la posta archivio tutto in cartelle locali.

Quando elimino una cartella locale, finisce giustamente nel cestino locale, e quando svuoto il cestino locale questo si svuota.

Il problema è che il giorno successivo, alla riapertura di thunderbird, mi ritrovo tutte le cartelle che avevo cancellato sia nel cestino locale che nella loro posizione originale (sempre in locale).

Ho già provato di tutto ma non riesco a risolvere, chiedo se questo problema è già stato riscontrato da qualcun altro o se avete suggerimenti.

Grazie in anticipo. Danilo

title: Show sender email address in inbox listing to detect forged senders
content:
I'm receiving many phishing emails, but when I browse through the list of emails in my inbox then this isn't obvious. In the "from" column I can only see the (forged) name of the sender displayed and not the sender's email address.

In the past there used to be an add-on to mitigate this problem, but that add-on doesn't work any more for TB 115.6.0 (64-bit).

The add-on was: "Show Address Only" Latest version 0.2.0 Released Sept. 19, 2019 11.9 KiB Works with Thunderbird 68.0 - 77.0 Current maintainer: R.I.P.

When I try to install it, then I get the message: "This add-on is not compatible with your version of Thunderbird. "

I would like to be able to instantly check the sender email address before opening an email. How can I list sender email address instead of only (a forged) name?

This should be basic functionality of Thunderbird.
creator: Marty1111

title: Address Book ? Auto  Retrieve Messages
content:
Fresh Thunderbird (115.7.0 (64-bit)) install on windows 11. Set up my POP3 (x4)accounts okay, but missing any form of the address book. When I click on "Tools" > "Address Book" , or hit CTRL+Shift+B nothing happens. The program is grabbing email addresses as when sending new messages I get the contacts button with previously used addresses, but no actual address book that I can add/edit addresses. I did try un-install and re-installing thinking i just had a bad install.

The second issue is that Thunderbird is no longer automatically retrieving emails on startup, even though I have the option checked for each email account. It is retrieving on the 10 minute intervals that I've set it too, but not on startup.

I'm a long, long time Thunderbird user, this is the first time I have ever had any issues. Any help would be much appreciated. Cheers

title: Setting changes in Thunderbird don't change.
content:
I am running Thunderbird 115.7.0 (32-bit) on a Windows 11 Home Dell laptop. Whenever I go to make a change in the settings or the account list, it does not save the next time I log in. 2 examples. I change the top of the message window menu from "Icons besides text" to "Icons Only", but if I close Thunderbird and come back in, the menu bar is back to "Icons besides text". This is annoying but bearable.

But recently, I tried to add another email/gmail account. I can add it without a problem, see my inbox, receive and send messages, etc. But again, when I exit the Thunderbird application and re-enter, the new account is gone and I have to add it again. Somewhere, a config file is not updating, but I don't know where. Any ideas? This is more of a "well, I guess I need to look for another mail client" problem.

Thanks, Chris

title: mozilla (very) slow and excessive RAM usage on high retention newsservers
content:
greetings to the forum. TB 115.7.0 (64 bit) on windows 10, 32 GB RAM, intel i7-6700 CPU@3.40GHz I signed up for an account on the newsserver astraweb.com which has a very high message retention, around 21 years in the groups I subscribed to!!! in two groups I subscribed to, it downloaded 1410000 and 3031000 headers (no messages)... since after this massive download it was slow and unresponsive often, I repaired the folders of those groups and deleted the startup cache... in response the TB re-downloaded everything again, remained not responding for about 20 minutes and during this process used over 20 GB of RAM memory (see attached image). now it's using about 8.5 GB RAM, but every time I click on one group or another of astraweb it freezes with a "not responding" message until some mysterious task finishes... I could try to limit the number of headers downloaded in the account settings but I will only do it if I have to... If I don't find some solution, this way TB is almost unusable...

before posting on bugzilla and before deleting the older headers, do you think there is anything else I can do to avoid freezing TB on that server?
creator: filigrana
